channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wire and pedestrian wait, 12th July
item.description:
Wire is dangling from traffic light and also pedestrian wait system doesn’t seem to work, never any green man, seems permanently to stay on red man

item.title: NEW Black bags dumped in Mayplace Lane today, 12th July
item.description:
No sooner than one bag is cleared form Mayplace Lane than another six (6) have been dumped. Today very sadly someone has identified the bronze age burial site ( a cemetery) as an easy place to dump their rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Lane, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Raised lump in pavement outside 73 Elfindale Rd, which i tripped over,, 12th July
item.description:
On 8.7.25 I tripped and suffered a broken wrist, plus badly grazed knees, other hand palm and nose requiring hospital and ongoing treatment. The raised lump was in dappled shade and so I could not see it. A person who lives in Elfindale Road and who helped me, told me that there have been a number of other trip accidents in this spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elfindale Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers left on the pavement, 12th July
item.description:
Barriers left on the pavement from the PRIDE event and no one came to pick them up, it is a health and safety issue and they restrict anyone who is trying to pass on the pavement. Please send someone to pick them up as it has been now longer than a week. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Upper James Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bush overgrown and cars parking, 12th July
item.description:
The bush so overgrown you cannot walk on the pavement. There is a parking bay there so it's not the cars fault that the pavement is blocked as they seem to be parked properly in line with the bay. It has been like this for a long time

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ivorydown, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
